intro: Cochlidiosperma frieseanum, commonly known as the Friesean cochlidiosperma, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Santalaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, spiny leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of Socotra, showcasing a range of specialized botanical features for survival in such conditions. It is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in local remedies.
